intro: Erigeron flettii, commonly known as Flett's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron flettii is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
